lines.text: Do you remember me? I'm Clare... People say you are mad, do you know that? When you went off to war they said you were fine, intelligent - and now you are mad, because... because you sing like the birds, you chase after butterflies and... you look at flowers. I think you were mad before, not now.
If the purpose of life is this loveless toil we fill our days with, then it is not for me.
You just saunter out of your house one fine morning and pluck God out of the air as easily as catching a butterfly. It's all too simple.
If what you say is true then the Holy Father will point out errors in my faith
They are restoring a consecrated ruin for love. Is that a crime?
He's been riding all night on a girl. Tomorrow is the battle, we must prepare!
War's a serious business
Such profoundity Bernardo
This is my death mask.
Come forward, sons of Assisi. God is with you!
Business is blooming, life is back to normal at last
These servants are just like animals!
That's obvious what was wrong with him. The boy needed a woman.
Don't be so clumsy, monsignor. It's L'Amour
What have the judges of men to do with me. God is my only judge!
Unfortunately, he isn't around to help us out.
So what do you want?
I want to be happy, I want to live like the birds in the sky. I want to experience the freedom and beauty that they experience.
Everyone will have his assigned place
[when the emperor enters the town]
But you are here! Streets ahead of me!
I want to help you
Words, words Bernardo. There was a time when I believed in words.
Come and let yourselves be built as living stones into the spiritual temple
God himself had come down from heaven to talk to him?
God has spoken to lots of people sometimes

[to the pope's guard]
No, not him. He is not with us! Tell him, Paolo, you are not with us.
Tell him!
I am with them
In our obsession of original sin, we too often forget original innocence.
You've brought me, dear children, great joy and a little sadness
I may curse the war because of the fever it brought to you but for business, it was a blessing

[to Giocondo]
We are not a regiment of priests for whom the sacred vow of chastity is the discipline. We are just a band of men who simply love God, each according to his own capacity.
He's ill! He's come back from the war because he ill. He's not a coward!
When you wanted your wife to speak like you, why didn't you marry the thick headed butcher's daughter?
What shall we do with the money we will make out of this war? Have you thought about that?
Aah! A true son of his father, hey Pica!
We'll save a fortune on indulgences

[to Pica secretly]
That lad's after a woman
Look, Francesco! See these! Family arms. Titled people
[smile]
on their knees they were. Cost me less than nothing

[to Pietro Bernardone]
You're a stupid, thick headed, vulgar animal. That's what you are!
Father! I wanna share the joy with you. Our treasures are in heaven not here on earth, don't be a slave of these! Throw it all away! Do as I do, it's so simple, be free!
Pietro di Bernardone, this will not do! How dare you disturb us when we are in the middle of saying our offers! What's the matter with you, man? Have you lost your senses?
That's not me, Your Grace but that lunatic over there!
I want to be a beggar! Yes, yes a beggar. Christ was a beggar, His Holy Apostles were beggars. I want to be as free as they are.
But Your Grace, even beggars show respect to their fathers!
I'm not your son anymore. What is born of flesh is flesh, what is born of spirit is spirit. Now, I'm born again.

[to the Consul]
This is beyond blasphemy! Do you suggest that you are in direct communication with the Word of God?
Bernardo, how do you like your chicken? Leg or breast?
We are all poor in the eyes of our Lord.
The hermits from Assisi. They're here to make submission to Your Holiness, their leader is
[a pause]
Francesco. Just an ordinary blessing, Your Holiness, to gratify bishop Guido.

[to Francesco]
You asked permission to speak to us. Well, speak!
[a moment of silence]
Speak!
Don't be alarmed, His Holiness knows what He's doing. This is the man who will talk to the poor and bring them back to us.
